page.title: 14SPEECH
page.content: In this area we speak with a North Country accent.We also have a{dialect which means we use words which people from other areas don't use or understand.Sometimes we are lazy and just don't pronounce {words}properly e.g. we miss out the letter 't'-water becomes waher.We say seen instead of saw and done instead of did.Here are some of our words:-bairn-child,spuggy- sparrow,laggy band-elastic band,hiya- hello,howay-come on,beck-stream,safter -this afternoon. We also have some sayings in our local{language}which may not be used elsewhere:-to play war with-to tell off,get wrong-get into trouble,brag of you-telltales about you,feed your face-eat greedily. Our language is simple and uncomplicated and sometimes is not appreciated by people from other areas.
